description: The U.S. turned over Qais al-Khazali, one of the suspected leaders of a Shiite insurgent group believed to be behind the kidnapping of Peter Moore, to Iraqi authorities.
title: U.S. Transferred Detainee Before Hostage Release
title_page: U.S. Transferred Detainee Before Hostage Release - The New York Times
maintext:
BAGHDAD  Only hours before a British hostage was released, the American military turned over to Iraqi authorities one of the suspected leaders of a Shiite insurgent group believed to be behind the kidnapping, Iraqi officials said Thursday.
Both the Iraqi government and United States military officials in Iraq on Thursday denied that the British hostage, Peter Moore, had been freed after more than two years in captivity in exchange for the transfer of the suspected insurgent leader from American to Iraqi custody.
Mr. Moore, a computer consultant, and his four British bodyguards were abducted two and a half years ago in a brazen attack on an Iraqi government office. The bodies of three of the guards were recovered this year; the fourth is believed to be dead.
Mr. Moore was released Wednesday. The American military and the Iraqi government believe he was held by a militia called Asa’ib al-Haq, or the League of the Righteous.
